creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Corinthian column with heavy leaf ornamentation and scrolling motif at top; cluster of grapes in column's upper center; inscriptions on sides
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamp

-- inscribed in plate along both sides, with this at top: [VITRVVIVS]
-- numbered in plate at top: 3
-- in graphite on verso: B.253
markings: on verso: stamp, lower left: Heinrich Stiebel (Lugt 1367); brown stamp, lower left: Friedrich Quiring (Lugt 1041c); combined stamp, lower center: Städel Museum (Lugt 2357 and Lugt 2396, for duplicate)
provenance: Städel Museum, Städelsches Kunstinstitut and Städtische Galerie duplicate, sale in 1800s; Heinrich Stiebel (1881-1928), Frankfurt, sale 1920; Friedrich Quiring (born 1886, Gelsenkirchen); John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate, upper right: [HSB]; date in plate, lower left: [1543]
title: Corinthian Column
